The distance between two parallel hyperplanes defined by \( a^T x = b_1 \) and \( a^T x = b_2 \) is given by the formula:

\[
D = \frac{|b_1 - b_2|}{\|a\|}
\]

This formula calculates the distance by taking the absolute difference of the constants \( b_1 \) and \( b_2 \), divided by the norm of the normal vector \( a \).
